body.p: The IASB acknowledged that there could be situations in which an entity amended a hedging relationship as specified in paragraph 6.9.1 of IFRS 9 in a period before the entity first applied the Phase 2 amendments; and in the absence of the Phase 2 amendments, IFRS 9 would require the entity to discontinue hedge accounting. The IASB noted that the reasons for the amendment in paragraph 6.9.1 of IFRS 9 (see paragraphs BC6.608–BC6.609), apply equally in such situations. The IASB therefore considered that discontinuation of hedge accounting solely because of amendments an entity made in hedge documentation to reflect appropriately the changes required by the reform, regardless of when those changes occurred, would not provide useful information to users of financial statements.
